UI_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed in May 2023 due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion1. The center cited "unpreventable circumstances" as the reason for ceasing operations4. This closure is part of a broader government pressure campaign that has targeted LGBTQ advocacy groups in China, effectively shutting down spaces that served as safe havens for the community5. The shutdown of the Beijing LGBT Center marks a significant transformation in LGBTQ activism in China, reflecting increased restrictions on such organizations and spaces1.
traffic_visible_response: The Beijing LGBT Center closed in May 2023 due to "force majeure," which is described as a euphemism for state coercion [[1]]. The center cited "unpreventable circumstances" as the reason for ceasing operations [[4]]. This closure is part of a broader government pressure campaign that has targeted LGBTQ advocacy groups in China, effectively shutting down spaces that served as safe havens for the community [[5]]. The shutdown of the Beijing LGBT Center marks a significant transformation in LGBTQ activism in China, reflecting increased restrictions on such organizations and spaces [[1]].
